senses.sense_definition: Describing a ship or navy that is oceangoing and capable of operating in deep waters and rough seas, rather than just in coastal areas.

examples.text: The admiral argued that the country needed a <w>bluewater</w> navy to protect its international trade routes.
They bought a sturdy <w>bluewater</w> sailboat for their planned trip around the world.

senses.sense_definition: A large and well-known shopping centre located in Kent, England.

examples.text: We decided to go to <w>Bluewater</w> to buy all our Christmas gifts in one place.
The traffic around <w>Bluewater</w> can be very heavy on weekends due to the number of shoppers.

senses.sense_definition: A name for various towns, communities, or municipalities found in the United States, Canada, and Australia.

examples.text: The small town of <w>Bluewater</w> is located just off the main highway.
Residents of <w>Bluewater</w> enjoy the quiet atmosphere of their community.
